intro: Christella callensii, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
